website_summaries.verdict: A great mid-range deal for anyone with a larger laptop and lots of extras to carry, but the downside of the ample space is the bulkiness of the design.
pros: Stands out for its generously sized interior and multiple zippered compartments for efficient storage
cons: The design is bulky, and uncomfortable to carry when fully loaded

customer_reviews.title: I wasted $45 for the bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag, and within 1 month it ripped along the seam on the 2nd largest pocket. I called Targus to request a replacement, which took 6+ weeks to receive. I received the new bag last week and it has ripped again in the exact same spot!!!! This is ridiculous. I wasted $45 for the bag, and the $8 I paid to ship the first bag back to Targus.
customer_reviews.author: NicHeil

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS POORLY CONSTRUCTED BACKPACK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Targus backpack to replace my previous Targus backpack that - after 11 years - developed an issue with the zipper. Within a few weeks of receiving the new Targus backpack the fabric around the zipper frayed resulting in two holes. I have never seen anything so poorly made. I am especially disappointed because my last Targus Backpack lasted 11 years!!! AND, you only have a limited time to return for a refund (which I missed). I should have returned this backpack right away - when I first laid eyes on it - knowing that it would 'probably' fall apart. I am attaching photos
customer_reviews.author: Kimmykay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service - rude and unresponsive. Will never purchase Targus products again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack late 2016. I'm having an issue with the zipper separating after less than a year of moderate use. I contacted targus to request a replacement and I was pleased to have someone answer the phone very quickly. However, satisfaction stops there. I have 2 of these bags and they are both failing in the exact same spot. They will not ship me a new one. Very annoyed. Update. Targus still refuses to replace this pack. It is torn and is less than a year old. Terrible service and very rude representatives.
customer_reviews.author: Fun Guy

customer_reviews.title: WASTE of $$! Shoulder Strap and lining ripped after 2.5 months of use!
customer_reviews.text: We got this backpack in late April. My middle school son used it until late May, took the summer off and used it for September. Early October I noticed a rip in the lining, then yesterday noticed that the shoulder strap is starting to tear off. I admit his binder/lunch/water bottle can add up in weight, but no more than what should be expected. Of course I can't return it now, not sure yet if I have any recourse through Amazon. This is last time I will buy Targus, my husband's backpack front zipper ripped and the hardware on the strap snapped. Much better backpacks out there.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this bag now for about 16 months, and it's completely frayed. This is used to carry my laptop and padfolio and a couple of pens ans notebooks to and from work. It is by no means being used heavily. Paying $60 bucks and having it so destroyed makes me we wish I had paid an extra 15 bucks for the Swiss Gear, or 30 bucks less for a knock off. I'm ordering Swish Gear as a replacement as my sons 3 year old backpack used every day to carry his textbooks looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D.

customer_reviews.title: Neutral about purchase
customer_reviews.text: This bag was daughters choice as she wanted to protect her laptop. However, it is quite heavy before putting anything in it. I am hoping this means it is well constructed as we are only 4 weeks into school. By the time you put a laptop and the needed items in it is something I do not want to have to lug around all day. Not sure she should as I know it has to be too much for what she weighs and is carrying even with the bare minimum. So if weight is not an issue I say go for it however if it is I would say look on.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Morris

customer_reviews.title: Big, Sturdy, Well-Designed
customer_reviews.text: I wore out my old Targus backpack, and was initially disappointed that the model I had was no longer available, as it was the best backpack I'd ever had. Now it's only second-best; the current one is even better. The backpack is very large, with roomy interiors, and plenty of divisions. Sturdy construction, comfortable straps, good top handle. I take it everywhere, but it's especially useful for grocery shopping. I have put a truly astonishing quantity of groceries into it. The counter people are amazed. As I tell them, there are few things more useful in life than a voluminous backpack. This is a really good one.
customer_reviews.author: Xopher Halftongue

customer_reviews.title: Ok but.......
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack. I travel a lot and use it all the time. It is failing though after 2 years. The fabric along the top is ripping apart and shredding. Also the handle has cracked and broken so it is uncomfortable to carry by this handle. Nice design but mediocre quality. I have Jansport I've carried all over the world for the last 20 years and its still looks and performs great. To be fair I don't load it up like this one but it has stood the road test well. The Targus is OK but for this money I expect more.
customer_reviews.author: Creekside

customer_reviews.title: I have used this bag for 7 years, and it's still going!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see that they are still making this bag! I bought it in 2013, and have traveled all over the world with this bag (oh the good old days before Covid-19). Somehow, I was always able to pack everything in this bag. Lots of pockets and compartments -- it just seems to expand when needed.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Not for frequent users
customer_reviews.text: The straps started breaking down after a couple of weeks and some of the inside pockets began to tear. If you're going to carry a moderate number of books & a laptop around frequently, I'd recommend getting something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Kentrell Owens

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zipper, don't buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack because TARGUS is supposed to be one of the best names. I love the size of the Drifter II, but the zippers suck! First day of using it, the main zipper burst open on me, and I wrote it off as a one time thing, but in the little over a week I have had it, the zipper has opened all most spilling all the contents (2 laptops, 1 tablet, tons of cables, etc.)! I will be sending this back for a refund this week, as I need a RELIABLE travel pack!
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye, Targus.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very reluctantly leaving a bad review here. I really like the bag; the compartments are set up beautifully, the weight distribution is very good, it stays reasonably well ventilated in the southern US in the summer. But, I've had it about nine months. I'm gentle with it (although it can get heavy), but the end cap fabric on the hidden pocket zipper shredded and the car came off several months ago. Now the rubber padding the grab handle is splitting. In my opinion, any backpack costing over $50 should last 2-3 years with normal use. My previous Targus lasted a decade, but I think this is my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Leeloo

customer_reviews.title: Zippers don't zip or stay closed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement , was super excited with all the room and padding, started adding my work tools, cables and other items. Zipped up one of the zippers on the biggest compartment, didn't stay zipped, won't stay zipped came un-zipped not even 10 minutes after getting this thing. If it was cheap, then no big deal, it wasn't but quality isn't there Follow up another zipper broke on this piece of junk, put a coffee mug in the side pouch and it broke, so two zippers are bust on this junk
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: One of the best backpacks
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect backpack for traveling. It is extremely durable and held up carrying 10 pounds of equipment and clothes. The layout is amazing, and it has so many compartments its hard to keep count. That was the onky drawback, I lost an emportant document for a couple days till I found that pocket again. The lower back cushion is also a pocket. I own the ultimate Targus laptop case as well, but this backpack holds close to double its capacity. I would say Targus maintains an acceptacle level of quality with all the products Ive used. If you travel with cloths and a laptop, this is the backpack to get
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Targus anything!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack didn't last six months with light use. Sure it has a little warranty, but you have to pay to ship it in everytime. I'm on my fourth replacement and am in need of a fifth. I have paid more than a new backpack would have cost just shipping defective product after defective product back to Targus. Never again Targus.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Seam of zipper separated
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the quality. After 4 months of use the seam on one one the zippers started to separate and now there is 6 inch tear making the backpack unusable. I contacted Targus to request a replacement or refund and they require the product to be returned to them and then they will spend up to 10 days to determine if it is a defect meet the warranty. To me, that is not acceptable. I have no choice but to purchase a new backpack regardless if I return the backpack or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Buyer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Targus Drifter II. My first one lasted 10 years, went on 15 mission trips with me, was my carry-on bag on flights, was a mobile first aid kit when hiking/travelling, and carried my laptop & accessories everywhere. It was a workhorse with tons of room and flexibility. God took us on many different adventures, and I look forward to seeing what God does in my life with THIS one!
customer_reviews.author: C. Gober

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment on the quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this backpack with lots of expectations from all of the positive reviews. After one month of usage, I am seeing the bag falling apart! Very disappointed. Check out the attached photos ######. Updates. ###### After returning The first defective backpack to Amazon I requested a replacement. I was hoping the zipper incident was an anomaly and not on a consistent defect. Well, I was wrong. Apparently there is something wrong with the zipper they use on this new backpack. Within two days of usage, one of the zippers opened by itself. I ended up losing valuable items Unless Targus fix this critical issue, I would stay away from this backpack!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Artc

customer_reviews.title: This backpack used to be the best.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this exact backpack 3 times since 2011. I must say this third time has been a problem child. The zippers are not as good as the used to be. The zippers lose grip, and break apart, I be walking and the next thing I know the backpack is all the way open. I busy looking to see if I lost stuff. I spent more time watching the bag, worried that the zippers who not stay together. Until this is fixed, I cannot in good conscious recommend this bag anymore. Otherwise it was a great bag,
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Edward Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for international travel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for work international travel. Used for many years the traditional travel computer laptop bag. Needed something that would distribute the weight off of just the one shoulder. This works perfectly. Fits everything you need for international passport, wallet, tickets whatever your traveling needs are. This has completely made international travel much easier then the old fashion one shoulder weight bearing laptop computer bag. Highly recommend for anyone who has to travel domestic or internationally for work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Beware the zippers on this one!
customer_reviews.text: I have had other Targus backpacks over the years and was looking to upgrade. I love the pockets and layout of this bag, but was super disappointed with the zippers. In less than two weeks 2 pockets failed to zip in both directions, and the very front small pocket zipper constantly bits into the fabric, making it completely unusable. The pockets still close because they have two zippers so they can at least close in 1 direction, but for the money I spent I would've liked to have the added flexibility of being able to open and close in both directions. Looking at SwissGear backpacks now.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Caporellie

customer_reviews.title: Great, until 6 months in stitching ripped at top making it unusable.
customer_reviews.text: 3 months: Use it for work and everything seems great after several months of use. Sturdy and comfortable. Ideally would have a chest strap but fine without. 6 months: stitching at top of bag ripped along a seam about 4 days ago. Has steadily widened until probably tomorrow I wont be able to use. The inner lining is already falling out. But shortly the rip will extend down the sides making the pack unusable. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Gdiggity

customer_reviews.title: ... every day and I was looking for a really sturdy backpack. I usually only carry a laptop and ...
customer_reviews.text: I carry this to school every day and I was looking for a really sturdy backpack. I usually only carry a laptop and SOMETIMES I have a couple of books. Despite this light load, this backpack RIPPED in LESS THAN A YEAR. I didn't rip a backpack for 24 years before I started buying Targus and both bags that I bought from them ripped in less than a year. NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: rips easily, reinforce with superglue before you use
customer_reviews.text: great backpack bc it has so many pockets, but it rips easily. I would recommend taking superglue and superglue just outside the zipper line. there are two weak zipper lines, one below the "targus" label, and the other below the metal handle. don't put superglue on the zipper as this will prevent zipping. but put the glue just outside the zipper line in a continuous line the length of it. This will allow the bookbag to endure more stress. backback has most pockets on the market just needs reinforcement. I would give it 4 stars actually but gave it less to help this review attract attention.
customer_reviews.author: HVAC McPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Product quality decline
customer_reviews.text: This is the second backpack of this model I have ordered. The first one lasted for over 4 years with daily use and frequent travel. However, its replacement has now become not useable. The zipper for the main laptop compartment opens with movement and the teeth of the zipper stopped lining up. I have tried to realign the zipper and it appears to be defective. It lasted 2.5 months making it a very expensive back pack. VERY DISAPPOINTING.
customer_reviews.author: Polly PZ

customer_reviews.title: Owned 2 just not durable. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these bags 2013 and 2016. They are just not durable. The plastic around the strap has broken both times and the zippers have torn. I love tye design thats why I gave it a second chance. I don't even use it alot. Just for work in my vehicle. The storage is great but there is no way to repair it and once the plastic goes, you cant tote it. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: todd floyd

customer_reviews.title: Zip comes open while just walking
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for carrying my laptop and stuff. Compartments are OK, but the zips - on at least 2 compartments - come open easily while just walking around. The only way to avoid a major spill, given the way the compartments open, is to take the zippers and put them all around to one side; your natural action of centering them is dangerous. This lack of actual testing of the product resulted in spilt contents on a busy subway platform in Tokyo last week. In 15 years of using laptop backpacks, this is the first time for something like this to happen. I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Startupgeek

customer_reviews.title: Check bag out thoroughly please
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately one of the side compartments zipper broke an as a result the side pouch remains open. this is very disappointing. the reason i purchased this backpack is because i've owned a similar bag for about five years and its still very durable. i now have to seek a professional repair person to resolve this problem. i have promoted Targus backpacks and really disappointed. generally speaking i still prefer Targus products
customer_reviews.author: renzy21

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for about 2 years. It has loads of space in it and great organizing capability. The biggest problem is the straps will eventually fail. Both of mine are junk after occasional use (once per week) with mostly a 15 in laptop. Several seems on the outer pockets are coming apart, too. Lastly, the plastic outer carry handle grip is coming apart. Other than those issues the backpack is good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved it when i got it but it fell apart in 3 months terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very good useful backpack. Only thing they can improve is put a better handle on it. That was my review when i received it bit now i have to downgrade to 1 star. I used it for less than 3 months ans it ripped in so many places its beyond hope i an going to throw it away and buy a good backpack. I had a swiss gear backpack for over 6 years not a problem in sight this one ripped in 3 month terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Izak K.

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed, Poorly Made....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this Targus, 17-inch, laptop backpack for 4 months now. It fits everything my ole Dell computer bag held so volume’s not a problem. Also, it has the standard PC, paperwork, mouse/accessories compartments—which makes it a good design. The problem’s in the craftsmanship. 4 months, close to $70 of bag and the shoulder seams are unraveling, the handle cable’s (a piece used to reinforce the carrying strap—for esthetics or strength) ripped out of its stay, and some of the zippers are loose. Great idea! Poorly executed! Maybe another unit’s better built but, then it’s all statistically inspected so mine might have been one which fell through the quality cracks.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Tkacheff

customer_reviews.title: Gave me the what I need in larger capacity
customer_reviews.text: Large bag for carrying two laptops. Miss the open pouch in the for carrying a standard keyboard. Overall it works well, helps me keep things organized and takes abuse. The larger capacity, more weight and organization for access instead of weight distribution has created a harder to carry backpack. I haven't figured out if I can adjust around it with the straps or I simply need to organize differently. I simply ignore it and sometimes pay for it later with some shoulder or back soreness. It is a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: R. N.

customer_reviews.title: This is a durable backpack
customer_reviews.text: I am using this backpack every day, unzipping it multiple times a day. The zippers are very durable and it has LOTS of storage compartments. It was exactly what I was looking for. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MajikTim

customer_reviews.title: You'll get about 12 months of use before it fails
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased one of these before buying this one on Amazon. The fabric began to tear away from the zippers. I had liked the features of the backpack and made the assumption I had a defective one. Unfortunately it was outside the one year warranty. Bought this one and guess what?? Yep, same thing. 14 months later the fabric is tearing away from the zippers. My loading of this bag is NOT substantial. I have a Dell 2-in-one and a Dell small form factor laptop. Both are 12.5" displays, so they're not large, or heavy.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: The backpack is very well made.
customer_reviews.text: It fits most everything that I need for carrying my laptop around, plus room for additional personal items if necessary for an overnight trip. The only thing I miss from my older backpacks was the waist strap, which would not only would hold the backpack closer to my body, but also would transfer some of the weight from my shoulders to my hips, which I preferred. Other than that, it is a great item.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.  Spend a little more $$ on a different brand. Stay away from Targus
customer_reviews.text: Less than 2 months of use and 2 zippers are failing. This is causing the bag to open up and loose it contents. I contacted Targus. They want me to pay for return shipping so they can warranty it. It will cost $20-$30 to ship it to them. Spend a little more $$ on a different brand. Stay away from Targus
customer_reviews.author: M1M2M3

customer_reviews.title: the straps are pretty comfortable and it has a lot of compartments that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this right before traveling to China for work. Despite the measurements seemingly matching up to my 17-inch laptop, it didn't quite fit and so I had to put my laptop in the main compartment rather than the designated lap-top space. After about 3 months of heavy use, the right strap started to fray. Despite this, the backpack has held up for nearly 3 years now, though I take extra care to not further aggravate the strap. Aside from these issues, the straps are pretty comfortable and it has a lot of compartments that have come in handy over the years.
customer_reviews.author: G Tan

customer_reviews.title: BEST, HUGE, TOUGH bag out there... BUY IT, you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is AWESOME and huge. I was looking at a lot of other options... glad I chose this. Can't beat the price and Targus offers a LIFETIME warranty... doubt I'll need it, it's built TOUGH, but at least it's there. Recently used this on a flight as one of my carry ons... it held all my 'work' - laptop, cables/charger, magazines, pens and other paper work as well as about 3 days worth of cloths. I had a pair of hiking boots and toiletries in another bag, just didn't want to smash it in. This bag holds a TON, has LOTS of pockets and compartments and the 'shock' absorbing straps work great! Will most likely buy another soon!
customer_reviews.author: Nick the Fireman

customer_reviews.title: lasted almost a year
customer_reviews.text: It worked alright for carrying a laptop and a jacket. The main pocket and laptop pocket are connected on the bottom so any magazines I put in by the laptop slide under into the main pocket. The main pocket got a tear along the seam of the zipper. It has lots of small pockets, which is the reason I bought it, but they've just felt awkward throughout the year I've used it. Fortunately I saved my Targus from 2004 that still hasn't torn. Too bad I can't find a decent replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Awesome multi-purpose backpack!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend suggested this backpack and I'm glad I made the choice. I've had this backpack for over a year and it's still in great condition! I have had no problems and I use it for my art supplies, and I use it for going to school! I've also used it for traveling across the country a few times, and it's still in good condition and no problems with the zipper! I've held 2 laptops, books and many other things in it, it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design in organization and style. Lots of pockets. Very attractive looking bag. Favorite feature is the sunglasses holder on top. Use it constantly. Unfortunately the quality of the backpack material is horrible. The seams have torn near the zippers from the stress of loading the bag. The items I put in the large compartment were not overtly large or heavy and any other quality backpack would have taken the stress. Targus has an lifetime warranty as I have returned this bag 3 times to receive a replacement. But replacing the bag does not make up for its poor quality and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: I don't have a spare moment to review these items, but I made one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a very similar Targus backpack about 14 years ago, when I bought a new laptop from Dell. As an international marketing/sales manager, I used it daily. Three laptops later, the material began to fray were it was sawn to the zipper. I still use it as a utility backpack to carry other stuff on personal trips but it was time to replace it for business travel. I was so satisfied with that backpack that I bought this Targus Drifter II, which is almost identical to my previous bag. So far, I am extremely pleased and only hope that it will serve me half as long as it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: First one lasted five years! Buying another
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered the same unit as a replacement after five years of daily use. This thing has a lot of storage that helps me stay organized when I travel abroad. It has divider pockets so you can bring a laptop and a tablet and they don't rub against each other. A really well made unit in my opinion. I was happy I was able to get another just like my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J.

customer_reviews.title: Hugs the body instead of sliding down like the ones I had back in school and distributes ...
customer_reviews.text: Tons of space, rugged, durable, and isn't too bulky when loaded. We have one at work for mobile inspection, and carry a 17" laptop, clipboard with paper pad, 15 foot extension chord, 2 power cables for the laptop and our FaroARM. Hugs the body instead of sliding down like the ones I had back in school and distributes the weight nicely, which made want to buy one for myself as a gift for going back to college.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: this is an amazing bag not only is classy looking
customer_reviews.text: Targus is my bag of choice therefore this is a very bias review, however is truthful and honest without question.. this is an amazing bag not only is classy looking, is light, the bag colors are perfect, side pockets for a water bottle, a soft liner front pocket for your valuables cell phone, jewelry.. I have put thousands of air miles domestically and international still remains strong and tight.. it easily accommodates a 17" laptop, my three tablets, accessories plus what ever else I decide to put in it.. plenty of pockets and hiding places sometimes I have a hard time remembering which pocket I stored my passport.
customer_reviews.author: blackdiamond9

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again nor recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend to anyone, this started falling apart after 6 months, won't buy again i though different about targus product but reality crushed me
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo José

customer_reviews.title: Well made, generously sized backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for our teenage grandson, this is a replacement backpack for one that looked exactly like it (but different color) that lasted 5+yrs! The old one was really liked but starting to fall apart from daily usage. This one is generously sized and might be too big for a small school child or petite person but this was destined for a 6 ft. plus teen. Obviously the previous one was a proven winner and well constructed. Hopefully this on lasts as well
customer_reviews.author: canonwren

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Case Logic laptop bagpack to this bagpack. This bagpack is similar to a Wegner Swiss. My 15.6 MSI Apache laptop fits. Many compartments, I saw a youtube review and decided to purchase it. I have more space doesn't feel that my items are squished together. I can take my spiral notebooks, Nvidia K1 tablet, and misc items. I still have plenty of room. The shoulder straps feels solid so far. I had 1 week use so far. I added external hard drives on the side pockets. Great IT bag in my opinion. I do have a Wegner Swiss bagpack that is from my employer. I still rather use my own tech. Just my thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 Laptops in 1 Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this backpack 3 years ago for my new 17.3" laptop, and ended up carrying two laptops in it at once, a 17.3" and a 15.6" (customer VPN access, joy). Through it all, this backpack has hauled the load! After three years of daily slugs, fights to customer sites, and 1000s of flights of stairs, it finally had one buckle blowout, and it's time for a new one. Getting another exact same one, can't beat this one, you can stuff 2 laptops, all their adapters, and everything else under the sun into this one bag. And it's well padded to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and should fit most if not all laptops.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my laptop nicely (HP zBook 17) and leave plenty of room of other things. I wish it has storage for pens and other small items. Other than that it works well. It's comfortable and not too heavy (the laptop is the majority of the weight. There is a lot of extra room good for a few day trip. It may not be the ideal bag for laptops smaller than 17 inch screens. It will hold them they will move around in the laptop pouch.
customer_reviews.author: William A. H

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack just do not over pack it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for two years now. Comfort I found this really comfortable to wear. I usually carry a macbook 17", a lenovo pro yoga 2, calculator, water and clothes then misc stuff in the top pocket. Durability After about a month or two the front of the shoulder straps tore, that wasn't a big deal as its cosmetic only. The part that gave next was about a year and half later where the bag tore in the middle pouch next to the zipper but this was most likely from me packing it really tight. If you don't pack it tight it should last a really long time. The rest of the bag is still perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Just another Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but not durable.  UPDATED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in March of 2017. We've used it only 6 times to travel with. The seams on both sides of the on both sides of the main sipper have split and the bag is no longer usable. It's a nice looking bag with good storage but don't count on it lasting long.......... UPDATE: I returned it to the company @ my expense which was around $10. After about 3 weeks I received a new one in the mail. Just went to there website, started a warranty return and the rest is history!
customer_reviews.author: CRTjad

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Separating Zippers
customer_reviews.text: I had used this back for three weeks to travel with a 17" laptop. Two zippers of the front pockets have started to separate when zipped up. Bought a replacement same issue
customer_reviews.author: Jam Right

customer_reviews.title: Careful how you load it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking bag with lots of room. However, the zippers are to be desired. The top pocket (with felt inside) hasn't worked properly since I received it. I usually have to attempt to close it seven or eight times for the teeth to zipper correctly. Otherwise, it doesn't close properly. Additionally, if I load the bag with laptop, travel mug, etc, I often find that the zippers come unzipped, if you don't have them placed in the correct location along the zipper line. I never thought so much about zippers. Kinda weird until your bag doesn't hold shut and your laptop falls out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M Whetstone

customer_reviews.title: I need a new one after 15 years of moderate to heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: I had my last Targus backpack for at least 15 years before it came time to replace it. What happened was the fabric next to the top zipper started to fray and I just got tired of pulling threads out of the zipper. I call that excellent durability. The other things were the zipper pulls were almost all gone, no big deal. The new one is a bit different, a couple of extra pockets, the zipper pulls are now metal. The workmanship seems as least as good. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it for a durable heavy duty pack that can hold everything I need for my mobile office. The only thing it's not is small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product - Owned this thing for years and still kickin like the day I bought it!!!

Love this thing, now that I know I can get another one I might buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Graham

This backpack, although awesome, did not fit what I needed to use it for. I can see it being an amazing school/work backpack. I LOVED all the compartments (I need help organizing stuff), the tough water resistant bottom and the low price point. The deal breaker was it was too heavy and slightly taller than I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: LAmom

Great bag for the price.

Overall, I would not recommend this bag because i see the stitch quality to be poor.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh Panati

PROS: Plenty of storage capacity Lots of pockets for organization Can fit a large laptop Great for college Would make a good carry-on bag CONS: Not good for small frames (uncomfortable) Would benefit from a chest strap
customer_reviews.author: jss

My other backpack had straps placed slightly strangely, so I couldn't get it on quickly in the airport without some help.
customer_reviews.author: CreativelySpeaking

customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.author: Emilee

But it will not be a problem when we carry adequate weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: An awesome laptop backpack
customer_reviews.text: I had been deciding between the 16" and the 17" model. Thought I would save me a few bucks and give the 16" one a shot. Thing is that I have a 17" Dell laptop and wasn't sure it would fit. Sure enough, it does. It is a little snug at the top but otherwise fits fine. I have plenty of room to fit my power cord, external hard drive, mouse, small tablet, a couple books, I usually take my lunch to work in it too with lots of room to spare. It has survived a couple of multi day conventions all with ease. The straps are nice and comfortable over long use. I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Borba

customer_reviews.title: The ANSWER to ripping seams on the smaller version!
customer_reviews.text: I was not aware until recently that this Targus bag comes in a larger size. I - like many others who purchased the smaller version and experienced ripped seams from over-packing - was ready to call it quits. And then I found THIS one. Because it's larger, there's less stress on the seams. Which means this bag will hold out much longer than the smaller version. Hallelujah!
customer_reviews.author: TKinNYC

customer_reviews.title: Targus
customer_reviews.text: I get this backpack because I buy the same type 8 years ago and the only thing wrong with it, is the thread coming out from the strap because I always over packed it. If you need a lasting backpack, look no further because this is the ONE. I think it's the best backpack that has ever created.
customer_reviews.author: Newton G. Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Good bag.

customer_reviews.author: kevcarp

I have subjected this bag to less stress than I did it's predecessor so I am fairly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for travelling

The strap for the right shoulder has slowly started to come apart after years of wear and tear. I'm going to order a new one once it falls apart, as I am quite satisfied with the longevity and toughness of this model.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop bag for the daily commute with 15' macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: Perfect laptop bag for daily commute. The layout gives enormous space and you can stuff whatever you want until your shoulders break. Best features - Front pockets design to easily carry a mobile, wallet and keys without fear of mixing them each other. - Side pockets are just right to fit a water bottle - Plenty of room for 15 inc mac book pro, wish there is a bit smaller version of this bag. - Straps are designed well, I stuffed more than my previous bag, but because of good balance I didn't feel like carrying more weight.
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil K

customer_reviews.title: it's perfect. The zippers have held up well

Nothing falls out, it still feels great and looks great. The best part is it comes with a life time warranty do Targus will always replace it for you. I'm getting ready to send the one I have in so I can get a fresh one for the next four years.
customer_reviews.author: F. Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Quality is Poor, Bag Rips Over Time

So I hate to move away from it. Having said that, I'm going to try the Wegner and see if it has better quality.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.author: anonymous12345

customer_reviews.title: Being a student who also has a full-time job, ...

There is some stitching coming apart on one of the straps, but that is likely because I am not very gentle when I pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for IT professionals.

It holds all of his wires/cds/books without any problems and it has proven through a hurricane and a blizzard to be 100% waterproof. Even hurricane sandy couldn't take this bag down. I definitely got my monies worth on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

I paid for quality and I feel Targus delivered with the Drifter II.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great bag, has a lot of room
